content: Buy the bean sprouts just before you want to cook them. Some foods can last a while in the fridge, but the sooner you use bean sprouts, the better. For example, if you buy loose bean sprouts by weight, you will need to use them within 2 days. It would be best to buy them the same day or the day before. [4] If you buy pre-packaged ones, you need to use them before the "best-buy" date. The longer you let bean sprouts sit unused in the fridge, the more prone they'll be to growing bacteria. Choose bean sprouts with a pale color and a crisp, firm texture. Avoid ones that look brown, limp, wilted, or slimy. You should also avoid ones that have musty smell. [5] Make sure that your bean sprouts are refrigerated; otherwise, they are susceptible to bacteria. They can be pre-packaged, or they can be sold loose/by weight. [6] Store the sprouts in the fridge, separate from raw meat and seafood. As soon as you get home from the store, transfer the bean sprouts into the refrigerator. Keep them in the veggie drawer, separate from raw meat, including seafood. [7] You will be washing and cooking the bean sprouts eventually, but you still want to avoid cross-contamination with raw meat and seafood. Rinse the beans with cool, filtered water before you cook them. Wash your hands with soap and water first, then place the beans into a strainer or colander. Rinse the beans with filtered water, then gently shake them to remove any excess moisture. [8] You can pinch off this wispy, brown thread at the end of the root if you want to, but this is not absolutely necessary. [9] Bring 4 cups (1 L) of water to a boil over medium to high heat. This will be enough for 9 ounces (255 g) of bean sprouts. You can prepare more bean sprouts if you want to, but you'll need to add more water. If you are cooking more bean sprouts, use enough water to cover them. Add the bean sprouts and cook for 1 minute and 30 seconds. The water will die down when you add the bean sprouts, so let it return to a boil first. Once it is boiling again, set the timer for 1 minute and 30 seconds. Be sure to rinse the bean sprouts with filtered water first. You can also remove the brown threads from the roots, but you don't have to. Drain the bean sprouts in a colander. Jiggle the colander to drain the excess water, then set the bean sprouts aside for 5 minutes so that they can finish draining. If the colander doesn't have little feet to stand on, set it over an empty pot instead. This is important; otherwise, the extra moisture will dilute any sauces, oils, or dressings that you add. Use the bean sprouts in your desired recipe. At this point, the bean sprouts are ready to use. You can chill them and toss them into a green salad or add them to a sandwich. You can add them to a side dish, or you can turn them into a popular Japanese salad. If you want to turn them into a popular Japanese salad, keep reading! Combine the onion, scallion, sesame seeds, and garlic. Chop the scallion into small pieces first--the thinner, the better--then add it to a small bowl. Next, grind the toasted sesame seeds using a mortar and pestle, and add them to the bowl as well. Add in 1 grated garlic clove, then stir everything together. If you can't buy toasted sesame seeds, you'll need to toast them yourself in a dry frying pan for a few seconds. Peel the garlic clove before you grate it. If you don't have anything to grate the garlic with, use a garlic press instead. Stir the sesame oil, soy sauce, and salt into the bowl. Pour the ingredients into the small bowl containing the scallion, sesame seeds, and garlic clove. Stir everything with a fork until the ingredients come together. This step completes the dressing for the salad. You can use a different type of oil, if you want to, but the flavor may not be the same. Toss the dressing with the bean sprouts, then chill for 30 minutes. Pour the dressing over the salad first, then lift the salad repeatedly with a pair of salad tongs. Place the salad into the refrigerator and wait 30 minutes. Serve the salad immediately afterwards. You can save the salad for later, but eat it within 24 hours. Heat 1 tablespoon (15 mL) of vegetable oil in a skillet. Tilt the skillet around so that the oil coats it evenly first, then set the skillet down on the burner. Turn the heat up to high, and let the oil heat up; it's ready when it starts to bubble. You can use another type of oil if you want something more flavorful, such as peanut oil. Vegetable oil is recommended because it won’t impart a strong flavor to the bean sprouts. Add 1 small chopped onion and fry it for 2 minutes. If you have not already, prepare 1 small onion by peeling the papery outer layer first, then cutting off both ends. Chop the onion into small pieces, then toss them into the skillet. Fry it for 2 minutes, stirring it often with a wooden spatula. You can omit this step if you don’t like onion, or replace it with 1 clove of garlic instead. Add 2 cups (200 g) of bean sprouts and season with salt. Rinse the bean sprouts with filtered water first, then add them to the skillet. Season them with a 1/2 teaspoon of salt, then give them a stir. If you want to, you can remove the brownish threads at the ends of the white roots first. Sauté the bean sprouts over medium heat for 3 to 5 minutes. Stir them often with a wooden spatula as they fry, otherwise they won’t cook often. They are ready when they start to turn translucent and golden. This will take about 3 to 5 minutes. Be careful not to overcook them, however, or they will start to turn mushy. Serve the bean sprouts immediately. Like most fried foods, sautéed bean sprouts should not sit too long. Once they are ready, slide them off of the skillet and onto a serving dish. Sautéed bean sprouts make a great side dish. Combine the peanut oil, scallions, ginger, and garlic in a wok. Pour enough peanut oil into a wok to lightly coat the surface--about 1 tablespoon (15 mL) should be enough. Add 1/2 cup (50 g) of thinly-sliced scallions, 1 tablespoon minced ginger, and 1 tablespoon sliced garlic. Give everything a brief stir with a wooden spatula. If you don’t like peanut oil, you can use another stir frying oil instead, such as canola or vegetable. Fry the ingredients over high heat until they become fragrant. This will take about 1 to 2 minutes. Stir them often with a wooden spatula so that they cook evenly and don't burn. You’re not quite done cooking yet, so don’t worry if the ingredients don’t look cooked. Season the ingredients with salt and pepper. Start with a pinch of salt and a few shakes of pepper, then stir the ingredients again. Don’t worry if this doesn’t seem like a lot for now; you can always season the bean sprouts further later. Add 1 pound (450 g) of bean sprouts and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Rinse the bean sprouts first, then add them into the wok. Stir them to distribute the other ingredients evenly, then fry them for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring often. Remove the little brown hairs at the ends of the white roots first. Do not overcook the bean sprouts, or they will turn mushy. Serve the stir fry immediately. Once the bean sprouts are done, slide them off the wok and into a bowl. Serve them immediately, or they will look their texture. For a more filling meal, serve them over steamed rice.

<p>Bean sprouts are common ingredients in many Asian cuisines and are often used in salads or stir fry. The most common come from mung beans, which are sprouted commercially under specific light-dark conditions. They look like white roots attached to greenish seeds. Some may have brownish threads at the other end of the white root.</p>

<div class="section ingredients sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Ingredients">Ingredients</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="ingredients">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"></div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Boiled_Bean_Sprouts.5B1.5D">Boiled Bean Sprouts<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup></span>
</h3>
<ul>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_678659de0523b98ab262fb5f51297564" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_678659de0523b98ab262fb5f51297564" name="item_678659de0523b98ab262fb5f51297564_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">9 ounces (255 g) bean sprouts</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_00662b327b4929443bd4df43bac80e08" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_00662b327b4929443bd4df43bac80e08" name="item_00662b327b4929443bd4df43bac80e08_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">4 cups (1 L) water</div>
</li>
</ul>
<p><i>For Salad (optional)</i></p>
<ul>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_8ccd9befd7a4470616582bf98edbb29c" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_8ccd9befd7a4470616582bf98edbb29c" name="item_8ccd9befd7a4470616582bf98edbb29c_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1 scallion, chopped (optional)</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_aea6659606bea8b672dc150fc7497ba8" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_aea6659606bea8b672dc150fc7497ba8" name="item_aea6659606bea8b672dc150fc7497ba8_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1 tablespoon white sesame seeds, toasted and ground</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_f70a816f951e7e9226e8f0e405dd7536" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_f70a816f951e7e9226e8f0e405dd7536" name="item_f70a816f951e7e9226e8f0e405dd7536_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1 clove garlic, grated or pressed</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_7f1f66e9c741c30461e654e1f3bd132d" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_7f1f66e9c741c30461e654e1f3bd132d" name="item_7f1f66e9c741c30461e654e1f3bd132d_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1 tablespoon (15 mL) sesame oil</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_94ecda48b9af5646761a1898f2438892" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_94ecda48b9af5646761a1898f2438892" name="item_94ecda48b9af5646761a1898f2438892_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1/2 tablespoon (7.5 mL) soy sauce</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_f85ebc85ff952bf98d33eebeade465cb" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_f85ebc85ff952bf98d33eebeade465cb" name="item_f85ebc85ff952bf98d33eebeade465cb_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1/4 teaspoon kosher salt</div>
</li>
</ul>
<p><i>Serves 2</i></p>
<h3>
<div class="altblock"></div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Saut.C3.A9ed_Bean_Sprouts.5B2.5D">Sautéed Bean Sprouts<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup></span>
</h3>
<ul>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_1673de52665b947b7d184aa79f6cee39" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_1673de52665b947b7d184aa79f6cee39" name="item_1673de52665b947b7d184aa79f6cee39_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">2 cups (200 g) fresh bean sprouts</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_af74960aa0a13618076a4997bf424032" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_af74960aa0a13618076a4997bf424032" name="item_af74960aa0a13618076a4997bf424032_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1 small onion, chopped</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_9478ea400de6d24c9b63cbc23677f41c" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_9478ea400de6d24c9b63cbc23677f41c" name="item_9478ea400de6d24c9b63cbc23677f41c_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1 tablespoon (15 mL) vegetable oil</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_460f77b281439942b2df800bd197d2cd" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_460f77b281439942b2df800bd197d2cd" name="item_460f77b281439942b2df800bd197d2cd_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1/2 teaspoon salt</div>
</li>
</ul>
<p><i>Serves 4</i></p>
<h3>
<div class="altblock"></div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Stir_Fried_Bean_Sprouts.5B3.5D">Stir Fried Bean Sprouts<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup></span>
</h3>
<ul>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_3a658f9ce11651600d45c6c1042c5348" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_3a658f9ce11651600d45c6c1042c5348" name="item_3a658f9ce11651600d45c6c1042c5348_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">Peanut oil, to cook</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_a0cb08639254fb3521512089bc046948" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_a0cb08639254fb3521512089bc046948" name="item_a0cb08639254fb3521512089bc046948_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1/2 cup (50 g) thinly sliced scallions</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_e0d1b6bb5a6aca2267cd96df3ff72c1a" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_e0d1b6bb5a6aca2267cd96df3ff72c1a" name="item_e0d1b6bb5a6aca2267cd96df3ff72c1a_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1 tablespoon minced ginger</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_53b04e2cb9fb8a43e432496d984ca156" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_53b04e2cb9fb8a43e432496d984ca156" name="item_53b04e2cb9fb8a43e432496d984ca156_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1 tablespoon sliced garlic</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_47c3276fe4b909f3fb4f14caa01b74c1" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_47c3276fe4b909f3fb4f14caa01b74c1" name="item_47c3276fe4b909f3fb4f14caa01b74c1_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1 pound (450 g) bean sprouts, hair removed</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_e98bced367b46866b1cf0926ecc8991b" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_e98bced367b46866b1cf0926ecc8991b" name="item_e98bced367b46866b1cf0926ecc8991b_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">Salt and black pepper to taste</div>
</li>
</ul>
<p><i>Serves 4</i></p>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<h2 class="hidden"><span class="mw-headline" id="Steps">Steps</span></h2>
<a class="anchor" name="Preparing_Bean_Sprouts_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky steps_first">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Preparing_Bean_Sprouts">Preparing Bean Sprouts</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-1-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1535628" href="#/Image:Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-1-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Cook Bean Sprouts Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid1535628-v4-728px-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-1-Version-3.jpg" height="410" id="img_ef61244d7d" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_ef61244d7d')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Cook Bean Sprouts Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="410" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid1535628-v4-728px-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-1-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript>
<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Buy the bean sprouts just before you want to cook them.</b> Some foods can last a while in the fridge, but the sooner you use bean sprouts, the better. For example, if you buy loose bean sprouts by weight, you will need to use them within 2 days. It would be best to buy them the same day or the day before.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If you buy pre-packaged ones, you need to use them before the "best-buy" date.</li>
<li>The longer you let bean sprouts sit unused in the fridge, the more prone they'll be to growing bacteria.</li>
</ul>
<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/6/65/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-2-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/1/15/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-2-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/87/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-2-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/d/d1/Cook Bean Sprouts Step 2 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-c5412b5e6e" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bean Sprouts"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Choose bean sprouts with a pale color and a crisp, firm texture.</b> Avoid ones that look brown, limp, wilted, or slimy. You should also avoid ones that have musty smell.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup><script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-c5412b5e6e'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>Make sure that your bean sprouts are refrigerated; otherwise, they are susceptible to bacteria. They can be pre-packaged, or they can be sold loose/by weight.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 6" class="reference" id="_ref-6"><a href="#_note-6">[6]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/bf/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-3-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/0c/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-3-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/54/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-3-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/5/5c/Cook Bean Sprouts Step 3 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-b65642b332" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bean Sprouts"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Store the sprouts in the fridge, separate from raw meat and seafood.</b> As soon as you get home from the store, transfer the bean sprouts into the refrigerator. Keep them in the veggie drawer, separate from raw meat, including seafood.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 7" class="reference" id="_ref-7"><a href="#_note-7">[7]</a></sup><script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-b65642b332'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>You will be washing and cooking the bean sprouts eventually, but you still want to avoid cross-contamination with raw meat and seafood.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/fc/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-4-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/9/91/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-4-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cc/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-4-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/4/49/Cook Bean Sprouts Step 4 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-5cf7d5ca58" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bean Sprouts"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Rinse the beans with cool, filtered water before you cook them.</b> Wash your hands with soap and water first, then place the beans into a strainer or colander. Rinse the beans with filtered water, then gently shake them to remove any excess moisture.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 8" class="reference" id="_ref-8"><a href="#_note-8">[8]</a></sup><script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-5cf7d5ca58'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>You can pinch off this wispy, brown thread at the end of the root if you want to, but this is not absolutely necessary.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 9" class="reference" id="_ref-9"><a href="#_note-9">[9]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="methodad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="6381149051,4805470868" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">
<div id="methodad"></div>
<script>googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('methodad'); });</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addBodyAd('methodad')</script>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Boiling_Bean_Sprouts_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Boiling_Bean_Sprouts">Boiling Bean Sprouts</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/03/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-5-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/41/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-5-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-5-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/8/8c/Cook Bean Sprouts Step 5 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-2bcfbbd454" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bean Sprouts"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Bring 4 cups (1 L) of water to a boil over medium to high heat.</b> This will be enough for 9 ounces (255 g) of bean sprouts. You can prepare more bean sprouts if you want to, but you'll need to add more water.<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-2bcfbbd454'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>If you are cooking more bean sprouts, use enough water to cover them.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/9/95/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-6-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/22/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-6-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/25/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-6-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/6/60/Cook Bean Sprouts Step 6 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-0c92019f7a" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bean Sprouts"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Add the bean sprouts and cook for 1 minute and 30 seconds.</b> The water will die down when you add the bean sprouts, so let it return to a boil first. Once it is boiling again, set the timer for 1 minute and 30 seconds.<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-0c92019f7a'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>Be sure to rinse the bean sprouts with filtered water first. You can also remove the brown threads from the roots, but you don't have to.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/a6/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-7-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/0f/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-7-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bf/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-7-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/3/36/Cook Bean Sprouts Step 7 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-ce97d0ddeb" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bean Sprouts"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Drain the bean sprouts in a colander.</b> Jiggle the colander to drain the excess water, then set the bean sprouts aside for 5 minutes so that they can finish draining. If the colander doesn't have little feet to stand on, set it over an empty pot instead.<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-ce97d0ddeb'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>This is important; otherwise, the extra moisture will dilute any sauces, oils, or dressings that you add.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-8-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1535628" href="#/Image:Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-8-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Cook Bean Sprouts Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/de/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid1535628-v4-728px-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-8-Version-3.jpg" height="410" id="img_4d16fb8515" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_4d16fb8515')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Cook Bean Sprouts Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" height="410" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/de/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid1535628-v4-728px-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-8-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Use the bean sprouts in your desired recipe.</b> At this point, the bean sprouts are ready to use. You can chill them and toss them into a green salad or add them to a sandwich. You can add them to a side dish, or you can turn them into a popular Japanese salad.

<ul>
<li>If you want to turn them into a popular Japanese salad, keep reading!</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/6/62/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-9-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/49/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-9-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-9-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/c/cc/Cook Bean Sprouts Step 9 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-5ee43fe997" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bean Sprouts"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Combine the onion, scallion, sesame seeds, and garlic.</b> Chop the scallion into small pieces first--the thinner, the better--then add it to a small bowl. Next, grind the toasted sesame seeds using a mortar and pestle, and add them to the bowl as well. Add in 1 grated garlic clove, then stir everything together.<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-5ee43fe997'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>If you can't buy toasted sesame seeds, you'll need to toast them yourself in a dry frying pan for a few seconds.</li>
<li>Peel the garlic clove before you grate it. If you don't have anything to grate the garlic with, use a garlic press instead.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/3f/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-10-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/71/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-10-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/57/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-10-Version-2.jpg" data-src="/a/a5/Cook Bean Sprouts Step 10 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-c6cb655291" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bean Sprouts"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stir the sesame oil, soy sauce, and salt into the bowl.</b> Pour the ingredients into the small bowl containing the scallion, sesame seeds, and garlic clove. Stir everything with a fork until the ingredients come together.<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-c6cb655291'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>This step completes the dressing for the salad.</li>
<li>You can use a different type of oil, if you want to, but the flavor may not be the same.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/42/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-11-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/33/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-11-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/52/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-11-Version-2.jpg" data-src="/d/d2/Cook Bean Sprouts Step 11 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-70dc69d986" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bean Sprouts"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Toss the dressing with the bean sprouts, then chill for 30 minutes.</b> Pour the dressing over the salad first, then lift the salad repeatedly with a pair of salad tongs. Place the salad into the refrigerator and wait 30 minutes. Serve the salad immediately afterwards.<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-70dc69d986'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>You can save the salad for later, but eat it within 24 hours.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div id="tocad_wrap">
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="tocad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-channels="6381149051,4805470868" data-lateload="1" data-loaded="0" data-service="adsense" data-slot="3356467874" data-viewablerefresh="1" id="tocad_outer"><div class="step_ad" id="tocad"></div></div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addTOCAd('tocad')</script>
</div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Saut.C3.A9ing_Bean_Sprouts_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Saut.C3.A9ing_Bean_Sprouts">Sautéing Bean Sprouts</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/1/15/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-12-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/6/69/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-12-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-12-Version-2.jpg" data-src="/5/50/Cook Bean Sprouts Step 12 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-72e689f53b" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bean Sprouts"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Heat 1 tablespoon (15 mL) of vegetable oil in a skillet.</b> Tilt the skillet around so that the oil coats it evenly first, then set the skillet down on the burner. Turn the heat up to high, and let the oil heat up; it's ready when it starts to bubble.<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-72e689f53b'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>You can use another type of oil if you want something more flavorful, such as peanut oil. Vegetable oil is recommended because it won’t impart a strong flavor to the bean sprouts.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/8/84/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-13-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/b8/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-13-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/99/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-13-Version-2.jpg" data-src="/d/d8/Cook Bean Sprouts Step 13 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-da10d857e4" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bean Sprouts"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Add 1 small chopped onion and fry it for 2 minutes.</b> If you have not already, prepare 1 small onion by peeling the papery outer layer first, then cutting off both ends. Chop the onion into small pieces, then toss them into the skillet. Fry it for 2 minutes, stirring it often with a wooden spatula.<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-da10d857e4'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>You can omit this step if you don’t like onion, or replace it with 1 clove of garlic instead.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/e6/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-14-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/d/dd/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-14-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3e/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-14-Version-2.jpg" data-src="/1/16/Cook Bean Sprouts Step 14 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-8e9a4f3ddb" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bean Sprouts"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Add 2 cups (200 g) of bean sprouts and season with salt.</b> Rinse the bean sprouts with filtered water first, then add them to the skillet. Season them with a 1/2 teaspoon of salt, then give them a stir.<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-8e9a4f3ddb'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>If you want to, you can remove the brownish threads at the ends of the white roots first.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/f6/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-15-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/73/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-15-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/19/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-15-Version-2.jpg" data-src="/9/9c/Cook Bean Sprouts Step 15 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-049507ea72" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bean Sprouts"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Sauté the bean sprouts over medium heat for 3 to 5 minutes.</b> Stir them often with a wooden spatula as they fry, otherwise they won’t cook often. They are ready when they start to turn translucent and golden. This will take about 3 to 5 minutes.<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-049507ea72'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>Be careful not to overcook them, however, or they will start to turn mushy.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-16-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1535628" href="#/Image:Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-16-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Cook Bean Sprouts Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid1535628-v4-728px-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-16-Version-2.jpg" height="410" id="img_5d144ec3df" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_5d144ec3df')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Cook Bean Sprouts Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" height="410" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid1535628-v4-728px-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-16-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Serve the bean sprouts immediately.</b> Like most fried foods, sautéed bean sprouts should not sit too long. Once they are ready, slide them off of the skillet and onto a serving dish.

<ul>
<li>Sautéed bean sprouts make a great side dish.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Stir-Frying_Bean_Sprouts_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>4</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Stir-Frying_Bean_Sprouts">Stir-Frying Bean Sprouts</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_4">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/a9/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-17-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/1/14/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-17-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e3/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-17-Version-2.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-17-Version-2.jpg" data-src="/c/ca/Cook Bean Sprouts Step 17 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-4c019ff64f" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bean Sprouts"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Combine the peanut oil, scallions, ginger, and garlic in a wok.</b> Pour enough peanut oil into a wok to lightly coat the surface--about 1 tablespoon (15 mL) should be enough. Add 1/2 cup (50 g) of thinly-sliced scallions, 1 tablespoon minced ginger, and 1 tablespoon sliced garlic. Give everything a brief stir with a wooden spatula.<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-4c019ff64f'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>If you don’t like peanut oil, you can use another stir frying oil instead, such as canola or vegetable.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/e1/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-18-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/6/66/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-18-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e2/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-18-Version-2.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-18-Version-2.jpg" data-src="/5/50/Cook Bean Sprouts Step 18 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-e784848d13" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bean Sprouts"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Fry the ingredients over high heat until they become fragrant.</b> This will take about 1 to 2 minutes. Stir them often with a wooden spatula so that they cook evenly and don't burn.<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-e784848d13'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>You’re not quite done cooking yet, so don’t worry if the ingredients don’t look cooked.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/a3/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-19-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/00/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-19-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4a/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-19-Version-2.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-19-Version-2.jpg" data-src="/3/3a/Cook Bean Sprouts Step 19 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-100de5904e" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bean Sprouts"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Season the ingredients with salt and pepper.</b> Start with a pinch of salt and a few shakes of pepper, then stir the ingredients again. Don’t worry if this doesn’t seem like a lot for now; you can always season the bean sprouts further later.<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-100de5904e'));
//]]>
</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/e7/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-20-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/ff/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-20-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8c/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-20-Version-2.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-20-Version-2.jpg" data-src="/1/10/Cook Bean Sprouts Step 20 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-04bfed0981" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Cook Bean Sprouts"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Add 1 pound (450 g) of bean sprouts and cook for 2 to 3 minutes.</b> Rinse the bean sprouts first, then add them into the wok. Stir them to distribute the other ingredients evenly, then fry them for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring often.<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-04bfed0981'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>Remove the little brown hairs at the ends of the white roots first.</li>
<li>Do not overcook the bean sprouts, or they will turn mushy.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-21-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1535628" href="#/Image:Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-21-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Cook Bean Sprouts Step 21" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/73/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-21-Version-2.jpg/aid1535628-v4-728px-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-21-Version-2.jpg" height="410" id="img_87168a4dea" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_87168a4dea')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Cook Bean Sprouts Step 21" class="whcdn content-fill" height="410" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/73/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-21-Version-2.jpg/aid1535628-v4-728px-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-21-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Serve the stir fry immediately.</b> Once the bean sprouts are done, slide them off the wok and into a bowl. Serve them immediately, or they will look their texture.

<ul>
<li>For a more filling meal, serve them over steamed rice.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="How_to_Eat_More_Bean_Sprouts">How to Eat More Bean Sprouts</span></h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_5">
<div id="sd_container">
<div class="sd_thumb"><a href="/Sample/Ways-to-Include-Bean-Sprouts-in-Your-Diet"><img class="whcdn" data-src="/images/thumb/b/b5/Ways-to-Include-Bean-Sprouts-in-Your-Diet_sample.png/340px-Ways-to-Include-Bean-Sprouts-in-Your-Diet_sample.png" height="440" id="5cc42b9b9676a" src="https://www.wikihow.com" width="340"/><script type="text/javascript">

</noscript>
<span>Ways to Include Bean Sprouts in Your Diet</span></a></div>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Questions_and_Answers_sub"></a>
<div class="qa section sticky qa_show_unanswered_questions" data-aid="1535628" data-few_contribs="1" data-search_enabled="0">
<h2>
<div class="altblock"></div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="qa_headline">Community Q&A</span>
</h2>
<div class="section_text" id="qa">
<div id="qa_answered_questions_container">
<div id="qa_aq_search_container">
<div class="qa_section_heading" id="qa_aq_search_heading">Search</div>
<input class="qa_aq_search" placeholder="Type your query here"/>
</div>
<a id="qa_add_curated_question">Add New Question</a>
<ul class="qa_questions qa_aqs qa_waittheresmore" id="qa_article_questions">
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="543501" data-caid="544374" data-cqid="543518" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="" data-submitter_id="2685476" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="1">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Can you eat uncooked bean sprouts?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle" style="background-image:url(https://www.wikihow.com/skins/WikiHow/wH-initials_152x152.png)"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name">wikiHow Staff Editor</div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Staff Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Yes, you can eat uncooked bean sprouts provided you are healthy and the bean sprouts have been properly prepared. Wash your hands before handling the sprouts. Rinse the sprouts first under cool, running water, to clean them (some people rinse using apple cider vinegar for additional disinfecting; do not soak if you use vinegar or it'll change the taste). If cutting them, ensure that the cutting board or surface is absolutely clean. Wash your hands again after handling. Young children, the elderly, pregnant women and anyone with compromised immunity should stay away from raw bean sprouts, as the risk of bacterial infection is high. Cooking destroys any bacteria that might be found on bean sprouts, so if in doubt, cook them.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>0</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>1</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="543508" data-caid="544381" data-cqid="543525" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1539286" data-submitter_id="2685476" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="1">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Do I need to remove the thin bits at the end of the bean sprout?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle" style="background-image:url(https://www.wikihow.com/skins/WikiHow/wH-initials_152x152.png)"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name">wikiHow Staff Editor</div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Staff Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">No, you don't need to remove any bits off the bean sprout, as every part of a bean sprout is edible. It would be a very tedious job trying to remove a lot of pieces off bean sprouts! Just be sure to wash them properly before using.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>0</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>1</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="543500" data-caid="544373" data-cqid="543517" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="" data-submitter_id="2685476" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="0">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How can I keep my bean sprouts fresh and crunchy?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle" style="background-image:url(https://www.wikihow.com/skins/WikiHow/wH-initials_152x152.png)"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name">wikiHow Staff Editor</div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Staff Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">One quick way of ensuring that the crispiness of bean sprouts keeps when storing them is to keep them in a "bath." Choose a suitable container for adding them to and add the bean sprouts. Fill with water until the bean sprouts are submerged. Carefully move this to the refrigerator to store. The beans will stay crisp when stored like this, for up to 5 days.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>0</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>0</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="543506" data-caid="544379" data-cqid="543523" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="" data-submitter_id="2685476" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="0">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How do you know when bean sprouts have gone bad?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle" style="background-image:url(https://www.wikihow.com/skins/WikiHow/wH-initials_152x152.png)"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name">wikiHow Staff Editor</div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Staff Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Bean sprouts will go limp and mushy when they're no longer good to eat. They tend to mush together in the package, look and feel slimy and don't smell very good either. If you press them, they won't feel hard but will disintegrate some more. When they have gone bad, throw them away as they are no longer nutritious or safe to eat.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>

<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>

<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>0</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="77703" data-caid="78576" data-cqid="77720" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="369796" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="2" data-votes_up="11">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Can I keep them for a couple of days?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">If they're prepackaged, they should keep for at least a week. If they're canned, they should last for a while. If they're fresh, I would recommend eating them within a few days.</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="91233" data-caid="92106" data-cqid="91250" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="425379" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="3" data-votes_up="8">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Should I rinse bean sprouts before stir frying them?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">

<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Yes. Always rinse raw produce, whether you are cooking it or not. The majority of food poisoning is from unwashed produce.</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="78520" data-caid="79393" data-cqid="78537" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="441213" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="2" data-votes_up="4">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Why do the bean sprouts clump together in my chop suey?</div>

<div class="qa_user_area">

<div class="qa_badge"></div>

</div>

<div class="qa_answer answer">During the canning process, they're shoved closely together and preserved. They need to be moved around during cooking. </div>

<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">You can add raw bean sprouts to already cooked fried rice provided you don't mind the taste. <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Quick_Summary">wikiHow Video: How to Cook Bean Sprouts</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="quicksummary">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright summarysection" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player"><a href="/Video/Cook-Bean-Sprouts" id="summary_video_link"><img class="m-video content-fill placeholder" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e1/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-0-preview.jpg/1000px-nowatermark-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-0-preview.jpg" id="summary_video_poster"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('summary_video_poster')</script><div class="m-video-intro-over" style="visibility:visible"><div class="m-video-play">

</div></div></a>

if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-bf51811ffe'));

<div id="summary_wrapper"><div id="summary_text">
<h2>Article Summary<a href="#" id="summary_close">X</a>
</h2>
<p>To cook bean sprouts, start by rinsing them thoroughly in cool water to remove dirt and debris. To make easy boiled bean sprouts, bring a pot of water to a boil, add the sprouts, and cook them for 1-2 minutes before draining them with a colander. You can also saute bean sprouts in a little vegetable oil or stir-fry them in your wok with peanut oil. No matter how you cook them, enjoy your bean sprouts immediately for the best texture! <span id="summary_last_sentence">For more stir-frying tips, read on!</span><span class="sumpos_bottom" id="summary_position"></span></p>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="s-help-wrap" data-type="summarytexthelp">
<span class="s-help-prompt">Did this summary help you?</span><button class="s-help-response" data-finish-prompt="Thank you! <a href='#' class='firststeplink'>Return to the article to learn more...</a>" data-prompt-text="We are so glad to have helped!" data-textarea-prompt="Please describe what was helpful in the video..." data-type="summarytexthelp" data-value="1" type="submit">Yes</button><button class="s-help-response" data-finish-prompt="Sorry the summary wasn't helpful. <a href='#' class='firststeplink'>Return to the article to learn more...</a>" data-prompt-text="Sorry that the video wasn't helpful." data-textarea-prompt="Please tell us what you would have liked to see in the video..." data-type="summarytexthelp" data-value="0" type="submit">No</button><div class="s-help-feedback-wrap">
<textarea class="s-help-textarea"></textarea><input class="s-help-submit button primary" type="button" value="Submit"/>
</div>

<div id="qa_box"></div>
<div class="section tips sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Tips">Tips</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="tips">
<ul>
<li>Due to their high-water content, bean sprouts are unsuitable for freezing.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 10" class="reference" id="_ref-10"><a href="#_note-10">[10]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Do not overcook bean sprouts, or their will lose their crisp texture and turn soggy.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 11" class="reference" id="_ref-11"><a href="#_note-11">[11]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Add a little "kick" by adding hot chili oil to the olive or peanut oil for sautéing the sprouts.</li>
<li>Add bean sprouts to your next <a href="/Stir-Fry" title="Stir Fry">stir fry</a>, <a href="/Make-Fried-Rice" title="Make Fried Rice">fried rice</a>, or <a href="/Make-Chow-Mein" title="Make Chow Mein">chow mien</a>.</li>
</ul>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section warnings sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Warnings">Warnings</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="warnings">
<ul>
<li>The following groups should not consume raw bean sprouts: the elderly, toddlers and young children, pregnant women, and those with weak or compromised immune systems.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 12" class="reference" id="_ref-12"><a href="#_note-12">[12]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Bean sprouts are susceptible to bacteria because they are grown in warm, moist environments.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 13" class="reference" id="_ref-13"><a href="#_note-13">[13]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>

    "@context": "http:\/\/schema.org",

    "mainEntityOfPage": {

    },

        "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/73\/Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-21-Version-2.jpg\/aid1535628-v4-1200px-Cook-Bean-Sprouts-Step-21-Version-2.jpg",
        "width": 1200,
        "height": 675
    },
    "author": {
        "@context": "http:\/\/schema.org",
        "@type": "Organization",
        "name": "wikiHow",
        "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com",
        "logo": {
            "@type": "ImageObject",
            "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/skins\/owl\/images\/wikihow_logo_name_green_60.png",
            "width": 326,
            "height": 60
        },
        "sameAs": [

            "https:\/\/www.instagram.com\/wikihow\/",
